title: Salesman's Sample Book, 1900–1950
inscribed: Stamped on corner: "James G. Hardy & Co. Damask white and colored hemst."
dimensions: H x W (closed): 58.5 x 28 cm (23 1/16 in. x 11 in.)
description: Bound volume containing fourteen square damask napkins and one fragment. Two napkins have a corner cut out. Some in two colors.  Each sample has a paper label attached: "James C. Hardy & Co., Linens, Manufacturers and Importers, New York."

tombstone.epitaph:
Salesman's Sample Book, 1900–1950. Medium: linen, paper
Technique: damask. 1983-49-4.
